intro: Meconopsis psilonomma, commonly known as the slender meconopsis, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in a fine layer of hair, which helps protect it from harsh weather. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Meconopsis psilonomma is considered a rare and endangered species.
